body.name: Kenmore Floorcare Upright Bagged Vacuum, Blue/Silver
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 11 mins
features: BAGGED UPRIGHT VACUUM: Remove pet hair, dust and more with this lightweight multiflora, multi-surface designed vacuum for use in your home, den, or kitchen with a wide sweeper path.Specific uses:Dual Action
PET HANDIMATE: Air driven turbine spins roller brush to high RPM easily removing dander, stubborn pet hair and other debris off furniture, stairs, car and van seats
TRIPLE HEPA FILTER SYSTEM: Enhanced HEPA filter system traps 99. 97% of debris, trapping dander and dust inside the vacuum reducing allergy-induced pollutants in the room

ENHANCED CLEANING: At only 19. 5 pounds this lightweight unit includes a 2-motor system excels in suction strength. 4 height adjustments provide optimal airflow and cleaning efficiency for any surface
3 ATTACHMENTS-ALUMINUM WAND : Flexible hose and wand lengthens to extended reach of 10'. Dusting brush, crevice tool and second bare floor tool for convenient cleaning transitions
body.description: The Kenmore Elite Bagged HEPA Upright Vacuum with Pet Handi-Mate provides versatile cleaning convenience. Dirt, pesky pet hair, allergen-inducing dust and dander are no match for this multipurpose all-floors design, which cleans surfaces from hardwood, laminate to pile carpet with ease. The Pet Handmade has an air driven turbine which spins the roller brush to high RPMs, easily removing dander, stubborn pet hair and other debris off furniture, stairs, car and van seats. With the enhanced HEPA filter system, 99. 97% of debris, dander, dust particles, pollen and bacteria will be trapped and kept inside the vacuum, so exhaust air is clean reducing the number of allergy-induced pollutants in the room, which is ideal for allergy sufferers and pet owners. This upright vacuum uses a double-wall design with Power Flow technology to ensure you never lose suction while cleaning. The 2-motor system gives you deep cleaning suction power for every surface of your home, from deep pile carpeting to slick hardwood flooring and is designed to tackle all cleaning tasks with incredible power and ease. 4-position height adjustment positions the cleaning head for optimum airflow and powerful cleaning for bare floors to plush pile carpeting and rugs. The agitator does not spin while the unit is in bare floor mode or in the upright position to prevent floor and carpet damage. The Reach-Out telescoping wand includes attachments that help you get places you normally couldn't reach with an upright. Accessories include: Pet Handi Mate, dust and crevice nozzle to clean hard-to-reach places, and aluminum telescoping wand. All attachments are stored onboard the unit for easy access and storage. Make housework less of a hassle, by investing in this Triple HEPA pet-friendly bagged vacuum from Kenmore.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Advanced HEPA Filtration Captures 99.97% of debris, trapping dander, dust particles, odors, pollen and more inside the vacuum. Powerful 2-Motor System Combination of 2 motors provides effective brush rotation and powerful suction for deep cleaning. Power Flow Technology Double-wall design keeps air flowing to maintain suction power and performance. Flawless Floor Transitions A bare-floor switch shuts off the rotating agitator while maintaining airflow and full suction on hard surfaces for total clean.

4 Versatile Tools Functional attachments are stored on the unit for easy access and storage. Easy Access Controls Conveniently positioned where they should be - right at your fingertips. LED Headlight + Height Adjustment Headlight uncovers hidden debris and 4 height adjustment levels provide optimal airflow and cleaning efficiency for any surface. Above Floor Cleaning 30-foot power cord is perfect for large area rooms and lightweight telescoping wand extends for hard-to-reach areas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy and a bit tricky to maneuver but solid!!
reviews.reviewText: It’s a bit unwieldy due to size, weight and no swiveling head. I personally don’t mind this but can see how others would. the suction and power is fantastic. My use is about 95% LVP floors and 5% shag high rugs which is not the typical use case for this type of vacuum but it works very well. Had a bag less before and it would leave things behind on the LVP.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Durable like an appliance from the 70s
reviews.reviewText: I've had this for a year. I decided to buy a cheap basic vac after going through several higher end models very quickly. This vacuum reminds me of something my parents would have bought in the 70s-80s which is capable of outliving everything. It's basic, no frills. It's heavy. It's heavy duty. It uses disposable bags. It has good suction. It handles my long hair and dog hair. It has put some muscles on my arms. I've had zero issues.The hose is super short so this isn't great as a detail vacuum for ceilings or high places. It works fine for corners and furniture, just slightly annoying to move around. Probably not a good pick for anyone elderly. Looks like it comes with an extendable wand now though so that might make a difference (mine doesn't have one).Only real con is that it doesn't do great at getting dog hair off my couch. The suction for the hose is so much that it sucks the fabric right up and makes it too hard to move around. The pet hair attachment doesn't do it for dog hair at all.It's still a great sturdy simple vacuum, even if I have to brush the dog hair on the couch into a little pile so I can get it with the hose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Powerful, but cord does NOT retract
reviews.reviewText: Great motor. This is the most powerful vacuum I've ever owned, but I would not buy it again for two reasons.It is way too heavy, despite its claim of being "lightweight", to the point that no one wants to use it. We instantly go for the crappy, battery powered lightweight vacuum instead.Next, when ordering, I had filtered all vacuum cleaners on Amazon until I got to this one. The most important feature I checked was a retractable cord. Somehow, this model appeared in my search results, despite its not having a retractable cord, and I didn't catch it until I had put it together. I won't make that mistake again, but I'm adding it here in the event the filter isn't fixed before someone else lands in the same position. The cord is very long, which is great, but I never want to wind up another super-long cord again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I was skeptical but have been won over.
reviews.reviewText: I've always been a Hoover person, I've had 4 in 41 years & loved them. However, the company was sold a few years ago & I've seen the quality go downhill terribly. I've been looking for a new upright because my house has mostly wall-to-wall carpet & I prefer that over the canister. I have a JRT that sheds a lot & needed something with great suction. After 4 months of doing research, I decided on this Kenmore. I waited a month to write a review because I wanted to use it several times to give a fair review. I love this vacuum! I live in a one-story home so I don't have steps to deal with. It isn't hard for me to maneuver around at all & the suction is wonderful. I've used the Pet Handi-Mate tool on my sofa, it's a tweed type material so the hair gets embedded in it. I used it in a circular motion & found that it did a great job pulling the hair out. Yes, it took some work because of the type of material but it worked great. I love that the bags are of a fabric material & really holds the dirt & dust in without blowing it back out like my Hoover had been doing. There is no smell when running it. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase & would recommend the Kenmore Floorcare Upright Bagged Vacuum, Blue/Silver.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 0 regrets, 5 stars, best vacuum I've owned.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace a much more expensive Dyson made for pets, and of all the vacuums I've owned, this is the best vacuum. Leaves lines in the carpet just like the old Kirby my mom had when I was young. I was always having to clean hair out of the roller on my old vacuums, but not this vacuum. It sucks it right up, and because it's bagged (Dyson was bagless), I need to empty less. In fact, I've had it for a few months and don't think the bag is even half full yet. I also love that you can run the vacuum without the roller moving which is perfect for cleaning up loose cat litter on the tile floor. The only downside going from my old Dyson to this vacuum is the Dyson is quicker/easier to change over to hand tools in my opinion, because you have to bend over to free the hose on this vacuum.

Over the years, i've used cheap Sharks, a Bissel, a Miele, a SEBO and this Kenmore 31140 has to be the most powerful vacuum I've ever used. You can genuinely feel the power in your hand as you use it and the carpet actually *feels* clean after I've used this unit due to how powerful it is.Our house has tons of carpet, so to make it easier we have 2 vacuums (one for each floor). For the main level and stairs we have a SEBO E3 canister and on the second floor we have this Kenmore and without a doubt I can say this Kenmore is more powerful than the SEBO by far. I even did an experiment where I bought an adapter to be able to plug in a SEBO handheld air powered turbo brush to this Kenmore and that tool was louder when plugged into this Kenmore than it was on the SEBO, meaning this Kenmore was producing more airflow to spin the turbine faster than the SEBO could despite that vacuum costing over twice as much as this. On the Kenmore, the suction power remains consistent as the bag fills as well.We have an issue with a lot of long human hair on the carpet and not that much gets caught in the brush roll. In fact, whatever hair does get caught around the brush roll, comes off incredibly easily. In the past i've had Sharks where it would seem that not a single strand of long hair would make it into the dust bin as all of it would be bound around the brush roll, not the case with this Kenmore though.Despite this unit being powerful, its actually not too loud at all. There is no high pitched shrill you hear on cheap vacuums making it easy to bear. I really love that it has an LED headlight, not sure why these are absent on so many models nowadays.Contrary to what many reviewers say, despite it coming in at around 18 pounds, the vacuum is INCREDIBLY easy to push back and fourth. It rolls very smoothly. I've used a Shark Professional model in the past which physically was lighter than this Kenmore and within a few back and fourth passes, my ENTIRE arm would begin to hurt. This Kenmore despite weighing more than the Shark, never once gives me that feeling in my arm.The worst part about this vacuum, is the Pet Handimate. When you initially plug in the tool and start the vacuum, it is incredibly loud giving the impression that it means business...but upon putting it on relatively low piled carpet it slows down to the point of it becoming borderline useless. What I do instead is use the SEBO handheld air powered turbo brush from my E3 canister by using a reducer adapter so that it fits on the hose of this Kenmore and that works beautifully...better than on the SEBO actually.Another thing which may be worrisome for other people is the overall hose length. It's relatively short but not an issue for us.Beyond that, this unit is fantastic and I'm almost tempted to sell the SEBO E3 and purchase another one of these for the main floor and stairs.
